Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles at a high level everything concerning the game logic and interfaces with the VirtualView to update VirtualClients on its status, which is in turn modified by the Controller.

    • Field Detail

      • MINIMUM_PLAYER_COUNT

        public static final int MINIMUM_PLAYER_COUNT
        The minimum amount of players for an online match.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • offlineMode

        public static boolean offlineMode
        Allows to play a game without depending on the client-server architecture. Enabling this flag allows integration testing of the game only, without indirectly testing external aspects as well.

      • autoPilot

        public static boolean autoPilot
        Intercepts requests to the player and instantly provides the awaiting method with a random value between the legal choices. Enabling this flag allows to automatically run, and therefore test very quickly, complete games in less than a second each.

      • silent

        public static boolean silent
        Disables all output. Enabling this flag significantly reduces execution times in some of the beefier tests, since removing calls to the System.out saves a few hundred clock cycles per removed call.

      • finalFrenzy

        private boolean finalFrenzy
        Whether or not the standard game should be followed by an additional round in Final Frenzy mode.

      • roundsLeft

        private int roundsLeft
        The number of kills left before the game ends or enters the Final Frenzy. This also represents the number of skulls on the killshot track.

      • gameOver

        private boolean gameOver
        Whether or not the game has ended. This occurs after roundsLeft drops to 0 in Sudden Death mode, or after a full round is played in Final Frenzy mode.

      • participants

        private java.util.List<Player> participants
        The Players involved in the game.

      • currentTurnPlayer

        private int currentTurnPlayer
        The id of the player whose turn it is, inside the participants list.

      • boardType

        private int boardType
        The id of the Board schematic the game is being played on. This is never used during a game but needs to be saved in order to reload the game, should the Server go down.

      • board

        private Board board
        The board the game is being played on. This defines all possible movements.

      • virtualView

        private VirtualView virtualView
        A reference to the game's VirtualView through which the model sends requests to VirtualClients.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        private Game​(boolean finalFrenzy,
             int roundsToPlay,
             int boardType,
             java.util.List<Player> participants)
        This is the only constructor.
        Parameters:
        finalFrenzy - whether to enable finalFrenzy.
        roundsToPlay - the number of rounds to play, also the initial value roundsLeft.
        boardType - the id of the type of Board to play the game on.
        participants - the list of participants.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Game create​(boolean finalFrenzy,
                          int roundsToPlay,
                          int boardType,
                          java.util.List<Player> participants)
        This factory method creates a new Game with the settings specified by the arguments. It then proceeds to bind each of the participants to the Game.
        Parameters:
        finalFrenzy - whether to enable finalFrenzy.
        roundsToPlay - the number of rounds to play, also the initial value roundsLeft.
        boardType - the id of the type of Board to play the game on.
        participants - the list of participants.
        Returns:
        the Game.

      • getParticipants

        public java.util.List<Player> getParticipants()
        Gets the list containing the participants of the Game.
        Returns:
        the list.

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Gets the board the Game is played on.
        Returns:
        the Board.

      • getRoundsLeft

        public int getRoundsLeft()
        Gets the number of roundsLeft.
        Returns:
        the number of rounds left to play.

      • getVirtualView

        public VirtualView getVirtualView()
        Gets the virtualView bound to the Game.
        Returns:
        the VirtualView.

      • advanceTurn

        private void advanceTurn()
        Passes the turn on to the next Player.

      • playTurn

        private void playTurn()
        Executes a sequence of internal methods that form one complete turn.

      • play

        public void play()
        Starts the game.

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the game status to a .json file.

      • invalidateSaveState

        public void invalidateSaveState()
        Taints the current save state for this Game by applying an invalidity tag. This is done to prevent the option of replaying the last round of a Game that has already come to a conclusion.

      • load

        public static Game load​(java.util.List<Player> shuffledParticipants)
                 throws InvalidSaveStateException,
                        UnmatchedSavedParticipantsException
        This factory method creates a new Game based on a save state retrieved from a .json file.
        Parameters:
        shuffledParticipants - The list of Players attempting to join the reloaded Game.
        Returns:
        The Game.
        Throws:
        InvalidSaveStateException - when attempting to load from an invalidated save state.
        UnmatchedSavedParticipantsException - when the list of joining Players is not a permutation of the list of Players found in the save state.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates a string containing a summary of the game status. The intended use is for synoptic inspection and should not be presented to the end user.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string.
